inscription:
Oharame no
?? tsukau
kuroki-uri
Iro no sioki ha
me ni mo kakurenu
Fujimarotei Ichijin
medium: Hanging scroll; ink, color, and gofun on silk
text: Oharame were girls who brought in bundles of twigs to make charcoal. They were from Ohara, a village near Kyoto. The poem above reads: The white complexions of the oharame are more noticeable than the black brushwood they are balancing on their heads.
title: Two Oharame on the Bank of a Stream
